definition: close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
parents-in-law of one's offspring
surname Mi/name of an ancient state
secret/confidential/close/thick/dense
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms

sentences.english: What makes them want to be intimate?
The cure for triangulation is trust and intimacy.
sentences.chinese: 互相信任与亲密无间是根治第三方卷入的良方。

sentences.english: They conversed with the familiarity of a long-established acquaintance.
sentences.chinese: 他们俨然如老相识一样亲密无间地攀谈了。

sentences.english: They were glad to find out that they spoke the same language and soon became buddy-buddy .
sentences.chinese: 他们很高兴地发现双方志趣相投，很快变得亲密无间。

sentences.english: Izumi and I had a strictly compartmentalised yet totally intimate relationship.
sentences.chinese: 泉和我保持着一种泾渭分明却又亲密无间的关系。

sentences.english: Anxious people need to be close; they love to be intimate.
sentences.chinese: 焦虑的人需要亲近，他们喜欢亲密无间。

sentences.english: We are brothers as thick as thieves.
sentences.chinese: 我们手足情深亲密无间。

sentences.english: Prince Charles has a fantastically close relationship with both his sons, and because Camilla makes him happy they eventually accepted her as their step-mother.
sentences.chinese: 查尔斯和两个儿子的关系亲密无间。

sentences.english: I believe you and he were very close friends.
sentences.chinese: 我相信你和他是亲密无间的朋友。

sentences.english: Larry Dalrymple: The candidate likes to create a kind of chumminess in his speeches.
sentences.chinese: 该候选人喜欢在他的演讲里创造一种亲密无间的气氛。

definition: intimate/close
not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
to be estranged
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
to be kind and love one another (idiom); bound by deep emotions
inseparable (as form and shadow)
harmonious/friendly relations/on good terms with one another
to make no distinction between what's one's own and what's another's (idiom)/to share everything/to be on very intimate terms
as close as one's hands and feet (idiom); loving one another as brothers/deep friendship/closely attached to one another
as close as brothers (idiom); deep friendship
each other/one another
lit. heads rubbing together (idiom)/fig. very close relationship
family-like close relationship (idiom)
to treat each other as an honored guest (idiom)/mutual respect between husband and wife
to give one's bare heart into sb else's keeping (idiom); sb has one's absolute confidence/to trust completely/to confide in sb with entire sincerity
see 惺惺惜惺惺[xing1 xing1 xi1 xing1 xing1]
